title: Invalid trait resolution with HRTBs and blanket impls over closures

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
trait Handler<'a> {
    type Output: 'a;
    fn call(&self, param: &'a i32) -> Self::Output;
}

impl<'a, F, T> Handler<'a> for F
where
    F: Fn(&'a i32) -> T,
    T: 'a,
{
    type Output = T;
    fn call(&self, param: &'a i32) -> T {
        self(param)
    }
}

fn call_handler(handler: impl for<'a> Handler<'a>) {
    let value: i32 = 10;
    let _ret = handler.call(&value);
}

fn main() {
    call_handler(|x: &'_ i32| x);
}
```

I expected to see this compile, since `|x: &'_ i32| x` should implement `for<'a> Fn(&'a i32) -> &'a i32`, and therefore implement `for<'a> Handler<'a>`.

Instead, it gives me this error: 
```
error: implementation of `Handler` is not general enough
  --> src/main.rs:28:5
   |
1  | / trait Handler<'a> {
2  | |     type Output: 'a;
3  | |     fn call(&self, param: &'a i32) -> Self::Output;
4  | | }
   | |_- trait `Handler` defined here
...
28 |       call_handler(|x: &'_ i32| x);
   |       ^^^^^^^^^^^^ implementation of `Handler` is not general enough
   |
   = note: `Handler<'1>` would have to be implemented for the type `[closure@src/main.rs:28:18: 28:32]`, for any lifetime `'1`...
   = note: ...but `Handler<'_>` is actually implemented for the type `[closure@src/main.rs:28:18: 28:32]`, for some specific lifetime `'2`
```

It does not make sense for the closure to only implement `Handler<'a>` for a specific lifetime `'a`. Further, if I write an equivalent function definition like this:
```rust
fn identity(x: &i32) -> &i32 {
    x
}

fn main() {
    call_handler(identity);
}
```
It compiles with no issue. 


### Meta
